utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Hello, everyone. I am Dana Perino along with Kimberly Guilfoyle, Bob Beckel, Jesse Watters and Greg Gutfeld. It is 9:00 in New York City and this is "The Five."

utterances.speaker: PRESIDENT DONALD TRUMP
utterances.utterance: I have to do the right thing for the American people. He has the wrong man for that position.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Tonight, President Trump defending his controversial decision to fire FBI Director James Comey in his verse first sit-down interview, since the dismissal on Tuesday. Over 48 hours after the firing, Comey's outcome remains highly controversial with many Democrats alleging obstruction of justice. After some evolving White House accounts, the President gave his explanation for the termination.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Look, he is a showboat, he is a grand standard. The FBI has been in turmoil. You know that. I know that. Everybody knows that. You take a look at the FBI a year ago, it was in virtual turmoil. Less than a year ago. It hasn't recovered from that. Regardless of recommendation, I was going to fire Comey. Knowing there was no good time to do it. And in fact, when I decided to just do it, I said to myself, I said, you know, this Russia thing with Trump and Russia is a made-up story. It is an excuse by the Democrats for having lost an election that they should have won.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: President Trump also clarified that even with Comey gone, he expects the FBI to continue the investigation into whether his campaign colluded with Russia to influence the 2016 election.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: I want very simply a great FBI director.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: And do you expect that they would continue on with this investigation?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes, sure, I expect that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The President also denied all allegations of Russian collusion.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Look, I want to find out if there was a problem with an election having to do with Russia. There was no collusion between me and my campaign and the Russians. The other thing is, the Russians did not affect the vote and everybody seems to think that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And he maintained that the real story is not Russia but rather surveillance by the Obama administration.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: There's a big thing going on right now which is spying. And you can call it anything you want. The unmasking, and the spying. And to me, that is the big story right now. That's a very, very big story.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right. There's a lot of big stories in all of this, Kimberly, I feel stressed today. So much happening.

utterances.speaker: KIMBERLY GUILFOYLE, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Did you take a shoulder massage?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes, in the commercial break.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! This is a family channel.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: When a story changes like it did today, then you get more of the story. That's just inevitable. Where do you think the White House stands tonight?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, you know, because there's been several different, you know, explanations for one, justifiable termination. The President has the absolute authority. It's constitutional to do exactly what he did. President Obama had the same authority to do so. And Hillary Clinton if she were elected president, likely would have exercised the same authority and discretion and dismissed Director Comey. Right now, President Trump is trying to get out there to give the narrative and explain it but I think what would have helped from the beginning in terms of the communications was just sort of a clear delineated timeline. Because now people are trying to go back in and fill in the gaps, for what? No one is saying that this isn't something that the President has the authority to do.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And I don't hear a lot of people protesting to say that this is someone who overstepped his bounds and -- of the office by in fact stepping into the shoes of Loretta Lynch and the Attorney General by saying that this case should not be prosecuted. That was something that was improper for him to do. There's a number of things that happened since the timeline, going back to July 5th. President Trump had the authority to do this. He acted based on his evaluation of this person's ability and suitability to serve and made the decision to terminate. Informed his AG and his Deputy AG who then prepared the memorandums that backed up and justify the termination. That is where we stand. But still 48 hours later, you have the detractors. People trying to make something out of this. There's no evidence so far to suggest any kind of collusion with the Russians. There is no funds that have been, you know, averted or, you know, short staffed to be able to continue any investigation. So, what exactly is the problem?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, Jesse, one of the things also today was a suggestion that there was some hypocrisy from the White House that one of the things the Republicans had rightly said was that it was inappropriate for Loretta Lynch, the former Attorney General to meet with Bill Clinton on that plane, on the tarmac. Then she basically -- Comey says, okay, well, that is why I had to step in and basically crossed that redline into the prosecutorial role. Which basically leads to the frustration that Rod Rosenstein, the Attorney General says. But tonight, and there is more reporting on this in the New York Times tomorrow morning that President Trump met with Comey several times and was pressing him to ask him about an investigation. Do you see hypocrisy there?

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: I don't know if I see the hypocrisy. If people are saying, you are not allowed to really ask the FBI director if you are under investigation. And I guess the FBI director said he wasn't. And we also know that Grassley Republican and Dianne Feinstein Democrat both said, Comey said, Trump was not subject of an investigation. We're also hearing that none of Trump's top aides are the focus of the FBI investigation. Some of the reporting shows what's going on are two things. The counter intelligence investigation being done by the FBI is whether or not a handful of American citizens wittingly or unwittingly were compromised by Russian spies. The criminal probe by the FBI is looking into not collusion with the Russians but whether or not there were laws broken in terms of money laundering, tax schemes, and things like that. Lobbying. So, we also heard today from the guy at the justice that they don't need a special prosecutor. And there's tons of resources for this probe going forward.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So, I think we shouldn't point a special prosecutor to maybe investigate a lot of Democrats can't accept the fact that Hillary lost.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Bob, why, I don't understand also, why did the Democrats want a special prosecutor so much as soon as that happens, it all goes underground, there's no more comment and it really should, leaks should really stop at that point. And they wouldn't have any more stories to talk about.

utterances.speaker: BOB BECKEL, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Yes. The saddest point of my life was missing the last two nights on this show, believe me. I don't know where to start about this. But I will say --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Let me take the first shot at Lester Holt. That interview, you talk about wussing out.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh boy!

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: He let Trump get away with -- are you going to let me talk or are you going to --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, you used the word wussing so I said oh, boy.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Oh, wussing, okay. Well, wussing, you know, when Trump gets away with why -- like he did in this press conference, he says, listen, he says that Comey is a showboat. Right? He is a showboat. Everybody knows that. You know it, I know it, everybody knows that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Not a lie?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Well, wait a minute. Do you know it? Do you know it, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: You know it? You know it?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I did.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: But here is the -- today, the Republican, very conservative Senate Republican, head of the Intelligence Committee Richard Burr said of Comey, quote, "One of the most ethical upright straightforward individuals I've ever dealt with." I don't understand what the President is talking about. And of course he doesn't understand.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You could also be a showboat and be all those things.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: No, that is not true. That is not true. And listen, even the deputy, now the temporary head of that went up and said, that's not true. The people that work for the FBI strongly favored Comey and are terribly upset by this. Now, then you've got a few people, few FBI agents who didn't think it was a good thing not to prosecute Hillary Clinton. A few. But a very small number and that's Republicans. Are you interrupting me too?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, I was just trying to get Greg in here because --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, I'm good. I'm good. I can't wait until the c-block. You keep going.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: No, no, that's right. I just did and the last thing I would say is that, when the President or the White House said -- well, the President acted on the advice of Rosenstein and Sessions. And he wanted to wait for that report coming forward. Remember?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Uh-hm.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: What they didn't say was that he met with them both and said, I want you guys to write a case for why we can get rid of Comey.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Now, that's an outright lie. This guy is going to get away with it. But he's a liar. He's a buffoon. And the idea that somehow this guy can get away with this --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Did you call the President of the United States a buffoon?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: I did. And I'd say it again --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So, if I had called President Obama a buffoon, do you think that would be appropriate?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He probably did.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: I would have liked it but there's a difference.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: You don't like it because --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Okay. Can I get Greg in here now?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, no, no, please keep going.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, let's get you in. I want to get your take. Because you think that this is much ado about nothing?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Don't put words in my mouth.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Okay. What did you say?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I have three points to make. Everybody's got to chill. Number one.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Why is there controversy? Because we keep saying it's controversy. The guy who got fired isn't even taking it that badly! He's not upset. He is already sitting at home in his boxers eating ice cream. They saw them out in the garden, he was having fun. He is the least excited about this. He doesn't even care. So why do we care? Yes. Have you seen him? Anyway, by the way, Donald Trump asked if Comey, if he was under investigation and everybody said oh, my God, is that illegal? No, it is human. It is human. Let me finish.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh my gosh!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's like asking a teacher in a class like it, are you going to flunk me? It's human. Getting pulled over by a cop and you just wonder, like am I going to get a ticket? This is a human thing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, you've never get a ticket. I always get. Well, my point is this. You could sit here and go, oh, that's terrible. Oh, it is actually a human -- are you guys investigating me?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Greg --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That is what Trump does. No, I am not done yet. Because you had your like long monologue which made almost no sense, when you take out all the insults. When he was in that interview with Holt, you said that he lied. No, he actually believes in what he is saying. And who believes what they are saying, a person who believes that they are innocent. So, we can all sit there and laugh at what he is doing but maybe he actually does believe what he is saying. And maybe he thought -- because we have evidence of this, we have evidence of this, that he thought that the Democrats were going to be pleased by this decision. He was like a cat who carried in a dead pigeon to the owner. He thought he was going to get the applause, the kind of applause that Stephen Colbert got when he announced the firing. He was actually, he believed that this was a good thing. And that is why he is shocked now. And everybody here is like, oh my God! Oh my God! Lighten up. Relax.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Why should anybody relax? You said Comey is the only person not upset about this. Comey is going to get even for this. And he's got to find out one thing, we all going to find out one thing, that there is no way he ever told Trump -- no FBI director would ever say --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He didn't respond to that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Let me ask Kimberly --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, he will respond to that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Let me ask Kimberly, he's a former prosecutor --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I've never heard that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- about this one thing, that Greg mentioned which is that it's no big deal, it's just human. But there is a process that the White House is not supposed to call the FBI director or supposed to go through the Department of Justice. That was like the whole problem of Lynch and Clinton. That's the whole thing. Like from a prosecutorial standpoint, I'm not saying there's any law broken here necessarily but in terms of -- regard for the law, you have to follow the process to actually have the law regarded.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, that was interesting. Look, definitely there was a process to this that could have been more closely adhered to, in terms of any criminal violation or anything like that, I don't see that. But yes, you should follow the order and chain of command and go abide it. The rules are there for a reason. Nevertheless, we have a situation here where all the discussion about this isn't about the propriety as to whether or not the President have the authority to dismiss, a directive that he felt was not serving the best interest of the country and of the FBI but about the process, and about the communications and sort of the roll out like we discussed last night. Like the objections to the travel ban. So, that is something that is like, you know, a repetitive theme here. But in terms of the President, even Comey says the President had the right to dismiss him and the acting director said, he had the absolute right to do what he did. And in fact, Comey said the President had the right to dismiss the director of the FBI for any reason he wants.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Which is the reason that they should have given so that they could avoid all of this.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Nobody disagrees with. Nobody disagrees with. He has the right to do it. But he also dismissed that the FBI was investigating him on his Russian --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No. He is not investigating him. He's not investigating. I want to take --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Dianne Feinstein, one of your Democratic senators said also the President is not the target of the investigation. He also said something else, he said, the President of the United States is a buffoon. That buffoon beat your party in November. So, what is worse? Being a buffoon or getting beaten by a buffoon. Also, there's a difference between --

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Now, that was a little shocked.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- scandal and a conspiracy. You guys said that Benghazi was a conspiracy. Remember what happened at Benghazi? People died and the Democrats lied about it. So far President Trump has not lied once about --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And no one has died. So, I do not know where you are getting this scandal from. You're also saying that they colluded, you're also saying that the Russians and Trump colluded on the elections. How did Podesta get hacked? He handed over his password to a hacker.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: I didn't say they colluded. I said, they were looking into it. You guys are jumping way ahead of the game here. The game that whether or not there was collusion. And you say, there wasn't. I didn't say there was. But a lot of the investigation go forward and when it's done --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The investigation is going forward.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Yes. Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Hey, there was one other thing that happened today in the Lester Holt interview. Because President Trump was asked about the firing of National Security Advisor Michael Flynn back in February. Here is what he said.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: We fired him because he said something to the Vice President that was not so.

utterances.speaker: LESTER HOLT, NBC NIGHTLY NEWS
utterances.utterance: Did you know that he has had received payments from the Russian government --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: HOLT
utterances.utterance: -- that he had received payments from the Turkish government?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: No, but Obama perhaps knew that because he had clearance found the Obama administration and this is something they never want to report. He had clearance from the Obama administration. The highest clearance you can have. And I think it's a very unfair thing that the media doesn't talked about that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: This is also something, Greg, that the President I think is very frustrated with is that the FBI hasn't moved quickly enough on the leak investigation, that is a part of the Russia investigation. Right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: True. That is true. I'm interested from the psychological viewpoint, looking at Donald Trump. He is like a shark who doesn't realize, you know, a shark doesn't realize there is a commotion on the beach. He's just a shark. And that is what Donald Trump is. He's a shark with a comb-over. He is just going around, and he doesn't realize what's happening above the water. And going back to the point I made to you, Bob. I believe that he believes, I think he believes in what he is saying. Which is why when you say he is lying, it's not lying if you believe it is the truth. I mean, it's not -- again, you can't be in this prism of two ideas. An absolute nefarious creature or he's a hero. It's probably somewhere in the middle.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He's a shark in the swamp.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: He's a shark in the swamp. You believe that he believes Obama did in fact tapped his phones?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Absolutely. I think that he believes -- and then he will change his mind. And he will believe that. But I think what he's doing something, he believes it. I don't think he cares enough to lie about stuff. He just, when he feels something, he says it. He's impulsive and compulsive.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: And does that compulsivity carry out when you have the acting Attorney General who stands up and says something and he fires her? And then you have got the FBI director who says something in-front of a Senate Committee, and he didn't like that and he fired him? Do you think that was just a shark trying to eat the truth?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think Comey knew it was coming.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: If President Obama dismissed Comey or if Hillary Clinton -- people don't like it because President Trump did it. He has no obligation to keep him. I think it was an excellent decision. Comey really acted inappropriately, overstepped his bounds. Totally out of line. Everybody knows it. Nobody is disputing it. And by the way --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But the thing is --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Well, what's different does it make actually, does he have the right and the authority to do it, would you have preferred it if he did it right, when he came in?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Sure. Flynn having the highest clearance is under Obama. Flynn has the highest clearances from the time he became a general. So, it was right before Obama, number one. Number two, why Trump gets away with something like this? Lester Holt, I go back to this again. Let this guy get away with more stuff in that interview and why the press in this country does not, when they get a chance to face the sky, face to face and he boldfaced lies, why don't you say it?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. Maybe --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You never cared about the last eight years of President Obama when everybody was comatose, or Obama-tose as I often say.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Can they play patty cake with your guy for eight years and --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Interrupted him about 19 times in two minutes, Bob. Have you ever watched the video?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Yes. I did watch the video.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's all over the internet.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Last night, we showed you clips of the media going into full freak out mode over FBI Director Comey inspiring. Things haven't calmed down much since then. WHOOPI GOLDBERG, CO-HOST, "THE VIEW": It just feels like a cold. You know, first the whole Justice Department, everybody got -- it's just yes, it's got all of the -- it just feels kind of funky.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: I think the question you also have to ask, was this a coup or a firing or both?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But here is Rush Limbaugh with a different perspective.

utterances.speaker: RUSH LIMBAUGH, RADIO TALK SHOW HOST
utterances.utterance: It's not the Saturday night massacre, it's not Nixonian. It's none of that. It isn't even close to that. Nixon wasn't doing a coup. Nixon was president. Trump is not doing a coup, he is president. Leaders don't mount coups. Leaders have coups mounted against them which is what is happening here.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. So, Greg, do you think now this Russia conspiracy thing has become the Left's birth certificate rabbit hole that they're going to dive down no matter what happens?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: To be fair, every side has that kind of story. We have had them. And the left has them. And, you know, we will go after, you know, we will say Hillary has got to go to jail. That's our Russian story. So, everybody has one. When I see people on "The View" get upset, it's like when inmates complained about the food. I tend to like the warden. You know? So, it's like the entertainers right now are in Trump's jail. You know, in which they deserved because they have had free reign for eight years. This story is like a giant fiber brand muffin "The View" is taking with strong coffee and they are just crap out the hysteria.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Do you think --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, God! I mean, so nuts!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay. Do you think this whole clash for this Russia thing, is this about ratings, because right now, the more left in the media beats this drum, the more ratings they get, or do you think it's all about partisan politics?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, I think probably is that the investigation is taking so long. And it's likely to take a lot longer.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And so what President Trump said today and Sarah Huckabee Sanders, the Deputy Press Secretary said that he wanted it to end. And I think that's being taken out of context by some people in the media, by saying that he wanted it to end and that firing Comey will get it to end. I don't think that's what President Trump meant and that's what she meant. So, the overwrought analysis by some, by jumping to a conclusion, and like, that it is a coup, doesn't help the situation and does make it look hysterical but there is an investigation that's ongoing. President Trump himself said he wants to see it completed. And the FBI Director -- the acting FBI director today said that there has been no interference that the investigation has not been impeded and it will go on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Look at Venezuela --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Right. So, where is the problem?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You have to look at the United States.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This is what drives me crazy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: None of these celebrities ever look at what's going on around the world instead they say, there's a coup in America.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: We have a system and the system works.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Wouldn't a coup be if Comey illegally took Trump out? I think that is the definition of a coup.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes. Well, people are historically confused definitionally about what a coup is. And by the way, another one of the reasons in the report that states that why Comey overstepped -- how about the fact that he slowly walked the records request about Americans that are being surveilled and unmasked? That is a serious investigation. That is what the lead should be and all the news agencies should be talking about Americans being surveilled. About privacy rights. And about unmasking, who ordered it, who was unmasked and for what reason. That's a grotesque abuse of privacy rights in this country.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Well, if that was so grotesque, it should have ended when Trump got into office. But, you know, the fact that we have built a whole segment around Whoopi Goldberg --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I love Whoopi!

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Rush Limbaugh who is --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Stretch the truth on occasion and the fact that we built a whole segment around these two people --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Okay. There is a lot of this.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Can I ask you a specific question though? I missed you. I missed you so much.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: (INAUDIBLE) The Watergate situation. Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I am younger than you.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: I got you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I know. And you can tell by looking in the street. Let me ask you a specific question.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Yes, sure.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So, the Left is assuming that there is this big collusion going on between Trump and Russia. But let's start from the beginning.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Uh-hm.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What facts are there -- evidence to show collusion right now at this time?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Well, I think there's two important points that they're looking into. One is the Wikileaks, going to Russia and coming back into the United States.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay. Podesta gave the hackers his email address. That is Trump's fault?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Wait. Wait. There are 4,000 people -- wait a minute, what?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He gave his password to the hacker. How did Trump make Podesta do that?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: It wasn't just Podesta they were hacking.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Podesta's emails were hacked. All of them. That was the main components of WikiLeaks.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Leave it that aside, they were hacked. Right? And the other thing is that there is now some fairly conclusive -- 4,000 people were hacking into and sending it to Wisconsin, Michigan, and Pennsylvania fake news -- stuff out of WikiLeaks that they sent out there. Now, if you think for a minute that you don't have some evidence here that there were some people in the Trump operation that were involved with Russia, and if the Trump operation, getting money for their various projects --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Okay. But now --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay. I haven't heard Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No, no, no, no, no. I don't know I'm sorry, yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Being pump into the states --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That were beaten through the blue wall by Donald Trump?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I keep hearing these wild bedtime stories by Bob over here. And it's very fanciful. And I mean, there's no evidence. No one has come forward to say that there was any kind of collusion whatsoever. I haven't heard one factual statement to suggest or support that. There's an ongoing investigation.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: There is an investigation going on.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Right. And what has it produced? What have we heard -- so far, nothing. Okay. But so far, what has the report said?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So, if the report finds there's no evidence of collusion, are you going to apologize to the American people?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: No, I am not going to apologize. I will say, fine, that's the results.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay. So, you will accept the results?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Of course.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Okay. We heard it here. Up next, we will tell you why Hillary might need some good lawyers. When we come right back.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Welcome back. With the James Comey out of the FBI, does that mean Hillary Clinton should be worried about her email case being reopened? Today, the acting director of the FBI revealed for the first time that some agents were upset the criminal case against Ms. Clinton wasn't pursued.

utterances.speaker: ANDREW MCCABE, ACTING FBI DIRECTOR
utterances.utterance: I think morale has always been good. However, we had, there were folks within our agency who were frustrated with the outcome of the Hillary Clinton case. And some of those folks were very vocal about those concerns.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Also today, FOX News Catherine Herridge talk to a former FBI agent who suggested the bureau may read look at the Clinton email investigation as well as the immunity agreements given to five individuals associated with the case. Dana, what do you make of these developments?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, I am skeptical of former FBI agents or former CI agents making suggestions for what possibly could happen. This happened a lot in law enforcement because they have to remain anonymous so that they can communicate and that both agencies used a lot of former FBI agents or CIA agents in order to make their case. And so, I don't know exactly what will come of this. In the realm of possibility, in the world we're living in today, I could see it happening. But I will tell you this -- I think that the Trump administration has got to figure out who they're going to nominate for FBI director, and try to make sure this is a stellar nominee that they can get confirmed. Because this question will absolutely come up at a hearing that that FBI nominee will actually have to then say what is or her intentions would be even if they couldn't actually say, that will be a big sticking point for the Democrats. And I think that the country, the administration needs to get this settled down, get a nominee, get through confirmation as soon as possible.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yeah, I think great idea. Get somebody out there and to take up the new cycle.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: . with somebody -- quiet professional.

utterances.speaker: UNINDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Like me.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes. I mean, very similar.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I am. Did Hillary get away with something? Yes, but let her have it. I mean, she's already in jail. It's called life. I think -- you know what I think? I think Donald Trump should do something really, really brilliant right now. So Comey's out, Hillary's out, make Hillary be FBI director.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Have her investigate herself.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Have her investigate herself.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: If the FBI investigation and the way President Trump thinks it will, which is that there's no evidence of collusion. Then, at that point, maybe he should just tell the FBI that he's request is that they let this one go. But after the investigation is over.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right, Jesse, what do you make?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'd like to see they reopened the investigation. I like to see them pursue an investigation into the Clinton Foundation. Remember, the Clinton Foundation, I think right before Hillary's state department approve the access for these uranium deposits here in North America, money flowed into the foundation for Russian interests. And then on the email case, I think that her I.T. guy got immunity, took the fifth, and for other associates of Hillary took immunity. You know, I don't see how firing an FBI director is a cover-up, but keeping a secret server, deleting 30,000 emails under subpoena, and then smashing your iPhone with a blackberry is not a cover-up. It strikes me as a cover-up. And then the left keeps talking about collusion between Trump and Russia, I think collusion is when someone at CNN like Donna Brazile gives the big questions to Hillary ahead of time, that strikes more is collusion.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Is this Groundhog Day?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: No, because you've get the same talking points when you're on a rally, same thing with Hillary Clinton. Nobody cares about that. We're building this whole segment again, with all due respect, we're building this on the basis of a former FBI guy, who says that they do that. There not going to do that. It's another way to try to cover up for Trump's actions in Russia, and you try to bring us again. Guys like you, want to bring it out again.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: What actions in Russia? Bob, you just literally making stuff up. What actions in Russia? There's no evidence or proof of that. Yet, you keep putting forward this false narrative and it's puzzling and disturbing at the same time.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: It's puzzling and disturbing?

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Then why are they having this investigation?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I have a solution for this.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: So far.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Hear me out, guys. Hear me out, I have a solution.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Why would they do that?

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No additional funds have been requested.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You've just said there's no evidence. And then you've just said Trump doing serious things in Russia.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: I didn't say there was no evidence. I said that it's not out yet.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: But your story is like -- role of you from three years ago.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do you not see the parallel in these stories that they're exactly the same. That on one side you have people screaming about Russia and Putin and collusion, and on the other side you have people screaming about Hillary and emails. They're almost identical if you took out the subjects and reversed them, you wouldn't know the difference. So my point is why don't they just cancel it out? You can have your story, we'll have ours.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Screaming about the Clinton email.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Comey, after an overwhelming amount of evidence dropped the case against Hillary, and of a very little evidence so far pursuing this Russia thing. That's a very big difference to me.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: That's because you don't know what evidence they're pursuing. They may have 28.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's pretty clear when Hillary had the secret server.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: They made a decision. He made a decision, didn't he? That's over.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Not yet. It might be reopened.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You should be worried it if there's no evidence.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Bob, this is a family hour.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: You're right. I'm sorry, it is.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Is it really nice, you meant? Santa Claus is really nice.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Nice.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There you go.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: There really is a Santa Claus.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: I got yelled at that before.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Can I go?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Let's go now to a commercial break.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: More cowardly action by college students. We'll show you a stunning active disrespect, right after this break.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So you want to talk about bravery, the difference between standing alone and predictable groupthink? Role this please. Compare Education Secretary Betsy DeVos, giving a commencement speech and then the students at Bethune-Cookman University where she was on Wednesday:

utterances.speaker: EDUCATION SECRETARY BETSY DEVOS
utterances.utterance: I am honored to become a wildcat.

utterances.speaker: DEVOR
utterances.utterance: And it's a real honor and privilege to be with you as we celebrate the Bethune-Cookman University class of 2017.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: As DeVos took the podium at this historic black college, many grads turn their back on her, others booed and heckled. Still, she persisted. Not that the left who throw that phrase around would care. They enjoy seeing an outsider get clobbered. See how the media reacted. Mediaite, an industry web site that vomits predictable assumptions said that, quote, maybe DeVos should have taken the hint because of an earlier petition that was circulated against her appearance at the school. It's really sad what's happening and it's happening very quickly in rapid succession across this country. And it's not -- institutions of education. It's institution of ignorance that don't even let anybody speak or try to listen or understand a different point of view. I think she handled herself with composure, and I commend the university for the way they handled it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: BECKEL

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Because you don't know that it's true.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: It would be a good guess.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL

This woman has attacked over and over the public education system, and particularly in Detroit and in minority areas. These kids came out of those schools and made their way through and are graduating, and this woman has done everything she can with all the millions of dollars she has, to undermine public education.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Or make it better.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: You may think to make it better, but this woman has been attacking.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Everybody is pro-choice.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: No, no, no, we don't.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's what you're saying. BECKEL: I don't want to limit choices, but we can't -- you're not going to be able to get every child into another school.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: So that makes it OK?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Like two bags end the break?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: No, no, no, because one of the things that Republicans do -- you all jump on public education. You know most people in this country like their public education.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Those people like their health care, too, right?

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: Listen, it's like saying you've made a bad choice like going to a public school system. These kids, if I were them, I would not have showed up, number one. The real person who I think the villain here, whoever invited this right wing anti-minority school person.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: BECKEL
utterances.utterance: I didn't say that.

utterances.speaker: BECKEL

utterances.speaker: GUIFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I haven't heard that one, have you?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
